intro: Cirsium semenowii, commonly known as the Semenov's thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pinkish flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, Cirsium semenowii is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
